data.name: XSLT_DefaultTemplate
data.value:
<xsl:value-of select='title'/>

Published:   by   on
  <a href=''> Enclosure (, Bytes) </a>
<xsl:value-of select='//channel/title'/>

Published:   by   on
  <a href=''> Enclosure (, Bytes) </a>
<xsl:value-of select='//item/title'/>

Published:    
  <a href=''> Enclosure (, Bytes) </a>

data.name: URL_WebHelp
data.comment: used to navigate to Bandit docs (Help)

data.name: URL_FeedValidationBase
data.comment: used to validate a RSSfeed, default on invalid .config

data.name: URL_FeedLinkCosmosUrlBase
data.comment: used to navigate to Technorati Link Cosmos, default on invalid .config

data.name: URL_BugReport
data.comment: Bug report page at Sourceforge (no logon required), default on invalid .config

data.name: URL_ProjectNews
data.comment: News page at Sourceforge, default on invalid .config

data.name: URL_WikiWebNews
data.comment: Bandit Wiki Site, default on invalid .config

data.name: URL_UserForum
data.comment: Bandit User Forum, default on invalid .config

data.name: RES_UpgradeInfoBoxCaption
data.comment: Caption of the Upgrade Info Messagebox

data.name: RES_UpgradeFeedlistInfoText
data.value:
The current version of {0} supports new program features or bugfixes, that requires a change of your feedlist file format. To keep your older versions running, the application will try to create a new feedlist file from your current list.
The old file will be left untouched.
Do you want to continue?
data.comment: Info text used to inform a user about a feedlist file format change.

data.name: RES_InvalidFeedFileInfoBoxCaption
data.comment: Caption of the infobox displaying an error message about an invalid feedlist file

data.name: RES_InvalidFeedURIBoxText
data.value: The specified URL for the new feed is not a valid URL
data.comment: Text of dialog if invalid URI specified when creating a new feed

data.name: RES_InvalidFeedURIBoxCaption
data.comment: Caption of dialog if invalid URI specified when creating a new feed

data.name: RES_ExceptionReadingFeedlistFile
data.value: Unexpected error on loading feedlist: '{0}'. Please have a look to the file at '{1}' for more details on the error occured.

data.name: RES_InvalidFeedlistFileMessage
data.value: The feed file was invalid. Please have a look to the file at '{0}' for detailed information about the error occured.

data.name: RES_GUIStatusValidationErrorReadingFeedlistFile
data.value: Validation error on loading feed list.

data.name: RES_GUIStatusIdle
data.comment: also displayed as a Tooltip on the tray icon

data.name: RES_GUIFieldLinkTitleInvalid
data.value: Neither the link nor title for the RSS feed can be blank!

data.name: RES_GUIFieldTitleInvalid
data.value: The title for the category cannot be blank!

data.name: RES_GUIStatusInfoMessageNoFeedsFound
data.value: Sorry no RSS Feed could be located.

data.name: RES_GUIFieldLinkRedundantInfo
RES_GUIStatusChildItemsNA
data.value: Unable to load child items, you are disconnected.

data.name: RES_ExceptionLoadingSearchEnginesMessage
data.value: Unexpected error loading search configuration: {0}. Please have a look to the file at '{1}' for details about the error.

data.name: RES_GUIStatusErrorInvalidSearchConfig
data.value: Validation error while loading search configuration list

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidSearchEnginesMessage
data.value: Validation error while loading search configuration. Please have a look to the file at '{0}' for details about the error.

data.name: RES_GUIStatusErrorGeneralFeedMessage
data.value: Action cancelled. Feed '{0}' generates an error: {1}

data.name: RES_ExceptionNewsItemTransformation
data.value: RSS item cannot be transformed to HTML.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNewsItemFormatterStylesheetMessage
RES_ExceptionInvalidXmlChracterMessage
data.comment: Due to the somewhat unspecific Xml exceptions (no error numbers) we had to detect a specific error message by string matching (this one) to find the message reporting a invalid character (they include the invalid char, that breaks our rendering)

data.name: RES_GUIStatusErrorEmptyTitleNotAllowed
data.value: Action cancelled. Title cannot be left blank.

data.name: RES_ExceptionStartDefaultBrowserMessage
data.value:
There was a problem starting your configured default web browser:
'{0}'.
Should we open the Url '{1}' on a new Tab?

data.name: RES_ExceptionStartBrowserCustomExecMessage
data.value:
There was a problem starting your configured custom executable '{0}':
'{1}'.
Should we open the Url '{2}' on a new Tab?

data.name: RES_FileDialogFilterOPMLFiles
data.comment: Text used to build Open/Save File Dialog file filters

data.name: RES_FileDialogFilterXMLFiles
data.comment: Text used to build Open/Save File Dialog file filters

data.name: RES_FileDialogFilterAllFiles
data.comment: Text used to build Open/Save File Dialog file filters

data.name: RES_WrongImageSizeMessage
data.value: Image is not of size 16x16 pixel.

data.name: RES_PreferencesExceptionMessageTitle
data.comment: Title of the messagebox displayed on exceptions with it's settings

data.name: RES_FormatExceptionRefreshRate
data.value: Refresh rate is not a number.

data.name: RES_OverflowExceptionRefreshRate
data.value: The specified value for refresh rate is too high.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNoProxyUrl
data.value: Provide the proxy address (IP or Host name), please.

data.name: RES_FormatExceptionProxyPort
data.value: Proxy port is not a number.

data.name: RES_ExceptionProxyPortRange
data.value: The specified value for proxy port is not in the valid range of 0 to 65535.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNoProxyAuthUser
data.value: Provide the proxy authentication user, please.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNoOnNewWindowExecutable
data.value: Provide the executable file path and name, please.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNoRemoteStorageLocation
data.value: Provide a remote storage location, please.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidFtpUrlSchemeForRemoteStorageLocation
data.value: FTP Remote locations needs to use the 'ftp:' url scheme.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNoRemoteStorageAuthUser
data.value: Provide a remote storage authentication user name, please.

data.name: RES_LabelTextRemoteStorageLocation.WebDAV.hint
data.value: You can store your application state as rssbandit-state.zip within a WebDAV folder. The storage service URL should point to a WebDAV folder, e. g. 'http://mywebdav.com/personal/' and you should be able to save and read files there.

data.name: RES_LabelTextRemoteStorageLocation.dasBlog.hint
data.value: You can store your subscribed feeds as blogroll.opml if you are a user of dasBlog (http://www.dasblog.net). The storage service URL should be http://yourblog.com/dasblog/ConfigEditingService.asmx and you should enable the Configuration Editing service in dasBlog.

data.name: RES_LabelTextRemoteStorageLocation.fileShare.hint
data.value: You can store your application state as rssbandit-state.zip on a local or network file share. Provide the directory path such as '\\yournetworkshare\feedlist\' or 'H:\'.

data.name: RES_LabelTextRemoteStorageLocation.ftp.hint
data.value: You can store your application state as rssbandit-state.zip using an FTP server. Provide the name of the FTP server and path such as 'ftp://yourserver.com:7788/feedlistfolder/'.

data.name: RES_RemoteStorageFeature.Info
data.value: You must configure Remote Storage through the Options dialog before you can use this command.

data.name: RES_RemoteStorageUpload.Question
data.value:
This will upload your feed list to the service configured using the Remote Storage tab of the Options dialog.
Proceed?

data.name: RES_RemoteStorageDownload.Question
data.value:
This will replace your local feed list with one downloaded from the service configured using the Remote Storage tab of the Options dialog.
Proceed?

data.name: RES_PostReplyFormCaption
data.comment: Post reply to a Feed Item Form Caption. Param {0} is the item's feed title.

data.name: RES_PostReplyTitlePrefix
data.comment: Post reply prefix to a Feed Item Title caption. Param {0} is the item title.

data.name: RES_PostReplySentIdentityInfoText
data.comment: Post reply identity infos about properties we provide to the receiver.

data.name: RES_PostReplySentIdentityInfoTextEmptyValue
data.comment: Post reply identity info displayed for an empty property

data.name: RES_StatisticsAllFeedsCountMessage
data.comment: Display the overall subscribed feeds count. Param {0} is the number of subscriptions.

data.name: RES_StatisticsItemsDisplayedMessage
data.comment: Display the overall items per selection count. Param {0} is the number of items.

data.name: RES_ExceptionUISettingsSave
data.value:
Unexpected error on saving UI settings (.settings.xml):
'{0}'

data.name: RES_NameRequiredInPostReplyMessage
data.value: You must provide a name when posting a reply
data.comment: Message used in Post reply dialog.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidShortcutSettingsFile
data.value: Shortcut Settings File Could not be validated
data.comment: Failure Message if the file is not valid XML.

data.name: RES_ExceptionGeneralCritical
data.value: An error occurred and have been logged to file '{0}'. Please report it's content to the dev.rssbandit.org development team along with the following information:

data.name: RES_SecurityExceptionCausedByRegistryAccess
data.value:
To apply this functionality the application needs write access rights to this Windows registry key: '{0}'.
To get it work, please start the application from within the Windows File Explorer by selecting 'Run as...' from the context menu displayed on a Right-Click to the executable. Then choose the local Administrator account to run the application and try again.
The administrative rights are only needed to apply the requested functionality. It is not required to have them each time you run the application. Sorry for the inconvenience.

data.name: RES_MessageBoxDeleteAllFindersQuestion
data.value: Do you really want to delete all search folders?

data.name: RES_MessageBoxDeleteAllItemsQuestion
data.value: Do you really want to delete all items?

data.name: RES_MenuOpenConfigIdentitiesDialogdesc
data.value: Opens a dialog to manage identities...

data.name: RES_MenuOpenConfigNntpServerDialogDesc
data.value: Opens a dialog to manage NNTP servers and newsgroups...

data.name: RES_CertificateIssueOnFeedCaption
data.value: Information you exchange with feed '{0}' cannot be viewed or changed by other users. However, there is a problem with the feed's security certificate.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssueOnSiteCaption
data.value: Information you exchange with the site '{0}' cannot be viewed or changed by other users. However, there is a problem with the site's security certificate.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertCN_NO_MATCH
data.value: The name on the security certificate is invalid or does not match the name of the site.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertUNTRUSTEDCA
data.value: The certificate has a untrusted Certification Authory (CA).

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertUNTRUSTEDROOT
data.value: The certificate has a untrusted CA (Certification Authory) root.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertUNTRUSTEDTESTROOT
data.value: The certificate has a untrusted test CA (Certification Authory) root.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertPURPOSE
data.value: The purpose of the certificate does not match the required task.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertCHAINING
data.value: The certificate is already a member of the trust chain.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertCRITICAL
data.value: The certificate caused a critical error.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertISSUERCHAINING
data.value: The certificate issuer is already a member of the trust chain.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertPATHLENCONST
data.value: The certificate caused an error: path length const.
data.comment: Certificate issue dialog detail text (sorry, dunno what that mean...)

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertREVOCATION_FAILURE
data.value: The revocation of the certificate failed.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertROLE
data.value: The role of the certificate is wrong.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertVALIDITYPERIODNESTING
data.value: The validity period of the certificate is nesting.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.CertWRONG_USAGE
data.value: The certificate cannot be used for the required task.

data.name: RES_CertificateIssue.Unknown
data.value: The security certificate caused a general unknown problem: '{0}'.

data.name: RES_DialogQuestionNewAppVersionAvailable
data.value:
There is a new version available for download. Do you want to find out more?
If you choose NO, you will be reminded again later.

data.name: RES_DialogMessageNoNewAppVersionAvailable
data.value: There are currently no new updates available for download.

data.name: RES_FeedListNoChildsMessage
data.comment: Message Text displayed in the feedlist, if no child items are available (e.g. feed comments)
